entity_sound_features.config.pre_check.t:
If enabled ESF will cache all entity initial spawn conditions for all possible sounds when they first loaded.
If disabled ESF will cache the entities spawn conditions, per sound, only as the entities conditions are when that sound is first played.
entity_sound_features.config.log_setup.t: Will log the setup info of all sound .properties.
entity_sound_features.config.announce.to:
Allows ESF compatible sounds to be announced to the log.
Helps to discover possible sounds to modify.
entity_sound_features.config.suffix_beha:
Sets which method to use when choosing between multiple different suffixes supplied by the same property
E.G. sounds.1=1 2 3
Random = randomly pick every time from the whole set
Consistent = will pick the same suffix every time for the same entity (same as ETF textures)
First = will always pick the first suffix
Sequential = will cycle through the suffixes in order each time the sound plays
entity_sound_features.config.allow_entit:
Sets whether or not ESF will allow sounds to be varied for this entity.
If disabled ESF will only play the default sounds for this entity type.
entity_sound_features.config.entity_sear:
ESF must search for the source entity near to where the sound is played.
This setting determines how ESF will search for the sound source entity.
Exact means the sound x,y,z must exactly match the entity
1 Block means ESF will search a radius of 1 block from where the sound played.
Nearest will simply find the nearest entity, over any distance, this is really not recommended at all.
Client player will always use the client player as the sound source.
Block entities will only check the exact block the sound is played from.
